meanings.definition: The act of rising or floating in the air without any physical support.
meanings.sent1: During the magic show, the magician performed a stunning levitation trick.
meanings.sent2: The superhero's power of levitation allowed them to soar through the sky effortlessly.
meanings.sent3: The levitation of the balloon made the children at the party giggle with delight.
meanings.sent4: Her joy was like a gentle levitation, lifting her spirits higher with each passing moment.
meanings.sent5: The levitation of the feather seemed to defy gravity, captivating everyone's attention.

meanings.definition: The ability to make something rise or float in the air without any physical support.
meanings.sent1: The wizard's wand possessed the power of levitation, making objects hover at his command.
meanings.sent2: The scientist's invention revolutionized transportation with its levitation technology.
meanings.sent3: The levitation of the cake surprised the guests at the party, creating a magical atmosphere.
meanings.sent4: His charisma had a levitation effect on the audience, lifting their spirits with his words.
meanings.sent5: The levitation of the paper airplane was a testament to the student's creativity and skill.
